messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: digest 1925
messages.msgSnippet: No, no! She means she s not posting as a moderator, just as a regular Joe at this point! No offense or offensiveness meant!
messages.messageBody:
No, no! She means she's not posting as a moderator, just as a regular Joe at
this point! No offense or offensiveness meant!

:-) Diane

> Joyce
> (a regular poster)
>
> Oh I get it now - I'm not a regular poster, therefor my opinion doesn't
> count. It doesn't matter that we've been unschooling or whatever you
> want to call it for many years now. It doesn't matter that my opinion
> has raised two bright, inquisitive, daring, funny and smart kids. I
> joined this list the first time over a year ago and was disgusted by the
> attitude of people here - I still am.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: digest 1925
messages.msgSnippet: Ah, did I miss something?  I think this meant that Joyce wasn t wearing her moderator hat.  I m sure someone will correct me if I m wrong. I m really sorry you
messages.messageBody:
Ah, did I miss something? I think this meant that Joyce wasn't wearing her
moderator hat. I'm sure someone will correct me if I'm wrong.

I'm really sorry you have so much anger but I think you are allowing it to
cloud how you read lots of the posts.

Lynda

messages.msgSnippet: ... I *do* apologize! And this perhaps underlines why it s a good idea to ask questions first rather than jumping to conclusions. Joyce (not sure if I m a
messages.messageBody:
on 4/10/02 9:05 PM, Jeff & Kate Kerr at windystreet@... wrote:

> Joyce
> (a regular poster)
>
>
> Oh I get it now - I'm not a regular poster, therefor my opinion doesn't

I *do* apologize!

And this perhaps underlines why it's a good idea to ask questions first
rather than jumping to conclusions.

Joyce
(not sure if I'm a regular poster or Unschooling-dotcom moderator on this
one but certainly red in the face either way!)

messages.subject: Re: digest 1925
messages.msgSnippet: Joyce (a regular poster) Oh I get it now - I m not a regular poster, therefor my opinion doesn t count.  It doesn t matter that we ve been unschooling or
messages.messageBody:
Joyce
(a regular poster)


Oh I get it now - I'm not a regular poster, therefor my opinion doesn't
count. It doesn't matter that we've been unschooling or whatever you
want to call it for many years now. It doesn't matter that my opinion
has raised two bright, inquisitive, daring, funny and smart kids. I
joined this list the first time over a year ago and was disgusted by the
attitude of people here - I still am.
